alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 2:09AM CDT until May 06 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Missouri... St. Francis River near Patterson. .Due to recent heavy rain, the St. Francis River is forecast to slightly exceed flood stage near Patterson early this morning, with flooding continuing through the morning before water levels drop back below flood stage later in the day. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Francis River near Patterson. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 16.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
